summary: Go 1.23 introduces powerful iterator support, major timer improvements, new packages, and enhanced standard library with breaking changes for modern coding.

changes.description: Range-over-func: for-range loops can now iterate over iterator functions with signatures func(func() bool), func(func(K) bool), or func(func(K, V) bool)
Timer/Ticker major improvements: immediate GC of unused timers, unbuffered channels, reduced CPU overhead
Profile Guided Optimization (PGO) build time overhead significantly reduced
macOS minimum version increased to 11+ (breaking change for older macOS)
New stdversion analyzer in go vet detects Go version requirements
Optional telemetry collection for Go toolchain usage analytics

iter.description: New package providing iterator type definitions for range-over-func
iter.example:
type Seq[V any] func(yield func(V) bool)
type Seq2[K, V any] func(yield func(K, V) bool)

unique.description: New package for value canonicalization/interning to reduce memory usage
unique.example:
handle := unique.Make("string")
// Multiple calls with same value return same handle

structs.description: New package for struct field layout control and analysis
structs.example: // Provides control over struct memory layout

slices.description: Returns iterator over slice indexes and values
Returns iterator over slice values only
Returns iterator over slice elements in reverse order
Appends values from iterator to slice
Collects values from iterator into sorted slice
Collects values from iterator into slice sorted by custom function
Returns iterator over consecutive sub-slices of up to n elements

maps.description: Adds key-value pairs from iterator to map
Creates new map from iterator of key-value pairs

time.description: Timer and Ticker performance improvements - unused timers are immediately garbage collected
time.example: // Timers now use unbuffered channels and have reduced overhead

time.description: Behavior change: Reset on stopped/expired timer now returns false (breaking change)
time.example: // Old code may need adjustment for timer reset logic

crypto/tls.description: Encrypted Client Hello (ECH) support for enhanced privacy

net.description: Enhanced TCP keep-alive configuration with more granular control
net.example: // Better control over connection keep-alive behavior

net/http.description: Improved cookie parsing and handling for better HTTP compliance
net/http.example: // More robust cookie parsing edge cases

net/http.description: Enhanced file serving from filesystem with better security

cmp.description: Returns first non-zero value or zero value of type
cmp.example: result := cmp.Or(a, b, c) // first non-zero value

go/version.description: Reports whether version string is valid
Returns Go language version from release version

summary: Go 1.22 introduces revolutionary for-range improvements, math/rand/v2, enhanced HTTP routing, and significant performance gains.

changes.description: For-range over integers: range over integer values directly (e.g., for i := range 10)
For-loop variable semantics: each iteration creates new variables, preventing accidental sharing bugs
Experimental range-over-function iterators for future iterator support
Garbage collection metadata optimization providing 1-3% CPU performance improvement
Profile-guided optimization (PGO) improvements with better devirtualization and inlining
go work vendor command for vendoring dependencies in workspace mode

math/rand/v2.description: First v2 standard library package with modern random number generation
math/rand/v2.example: // Automatically seeded, no need for manual seeding

math/rand/v2.description: Generic random number generator - returns random value in [0, n)
math/rand/v2.example:
rand.N(100) // returns random int in [0, 100)
rand.N(uint64(1000)) // works with any integer type

math/rand/v2.description: Returns random int in [0, n) - replaces old Intn
ChaCha8 and PCG generators replace older algorithms for better randomness

net/http.description: Revolutionary routing with method-specific patterns and wildcard support
net/http.example:
mux.HandleFunc("GET /users/{id}", getUser)
mux.HandleFunc("POST /users", createUser)
mux.HandleFunc("/files/{path...}", serveFiles)

net/http.description: Extract path parameters from wildcard routes
Method-specific routing enables RESTful patterns without external routers
net/http.example: // GET /api/users and POST /api/users can have different handlers

net/http.description: Wildcard path matching with {name} and {name...} syntax
GODEBUG httpmuxgo121=1 available for backwards compatibility
net/http.example: // Some existing routing patterns may need adjustment

slices.description: Efficiently concatenate multiple slices of the same type
slices.example:
result := slices.Concat(slice1, slice2, slice3)
// More efficient than append chains

slices.description: Delete elements from slice by index range
Replace slice elements with new values

maps.description: Copy key-value pairs from one map to another
maps.example: maps.Copy(dst, src) // copies src entries to dst

maps.description: Delete map entries based on predicate function
maps.example: maps.DeleteFunc(m, func(k, v) bool { return v < 0 })

maps.description: Compare maps with custom equality function
maps.example: maps.EqualFunc(m1, m2, func(v1, v2 Type) bool { ... })

go/version.description: New package for Go version string comparison
Extract language version from release version

testing/slogtest.description: New package for testing structured logging with slog
testing/slogtest.example: // Enhanced testing utilities for structured logging

log/slog.description: Set minimum level for default logger

log/slog.example: // Faster structured logging with reduced allocations

crypto/tls.description: TLS 1.3 performance improvements and better cipher suite selection

cmp.description: Generic comparison function for ordered types

summary: Go 1.21 introduces built-in functions for common operations, WebAssembly improvements, and enhanced tooling.

changes.description: New built-in functions: min, max, and clear
go test -c flag improvements and better test caching

builtin.description: Returns the minimum of comparable values
Returns the maximum of comparable values

context.description: Creates context with deadline and cancellation cause
